Research Papers Read

This site is an archive of interesting research papers that I’ve read, along with the paper’s publicly available PDF. The purpose is largely to share papers that I haven’t been able to post on my blog. The papers are mostly relevant to researchers in decision-making and computational study of behaviour.


  • The Psychology of Curiosity : A Review and Reinterpretation - George Loewenstein (1994)
  • A simple algorithm for identifying abbreviation definitions in biomedical text - Schwartz (2003)
  • Virtual Economics: Applying Economics to the Study of Game Worlds - Lehdonvirta (2010)
  • Crowdsourcing the Future : Predictions made with a Social Network - Forlines et al (2014)
  • Emotion recognition using EEG signals with relative power values and Bayesian network, Ko et al. (2009)
  • Exploring Mobile Gaming Revenues: the Price Tag of Impatience, Stress and Release, Lescop et al. (2014)
  • A Free Energy Principle for the Brain, Friston (2006)
  • Unconscious Determinants of Free Decision in the Human Brain, Haynes et al (2008)
  • Human volition: towards a neuroscience of will, Haggard (2008)
  • On Ranking Opportunity Sets in Terms of Freedom of Choice - Pattnaik et al. (2000)
  • The Nature and Measurement of Freedom, Suppes (1996)
  • Zero as a Special Price : The True Value of Free Products, Shampanier et al. (2007)
  • Evaluating Choice, Jones and Sugden (1982)
  • Risk-Taking Behavior in a Computerized Driving Task, Vorobyev et al. (2015)
  • Perception of Risk, Paul Slovic (1987)
  • Emotions and Risk Perception, Lennart Sjöberg (2007)
  • The Effect of Emotion on Risk Decision Making: A Computer Stimulate, Wang et al. (2015)
